definition: weaponry/to hold (a weapon)/to wield/to rely on/to depend on/war/battle
to take advantage of one's position to bully people (idiom)/to kick people around

sentences.english: The manager threw his weight on a bad evaluation of a new employee who he did not like.
sentences.chinese: 經理仗勢欺人對那個他不喜歡的新員工做了懷的評價。

sentences.english: Mary bullies her little brother into running errands for her.
sentences.chinese: 瑪麗仗勢支使她的弟弟替她跑腿。

sentences.english: Some cadres' children take advantage of their parents' power to bully their classmates at school.
sentences.chinese: 某些幹部子女仗勢欺人，在學校欺負同班同學。

sentences.english: And a friend who bullies us is no longer a friend.
sentences.chinese: 仗勢欺人就算不上是真正的朋友。

sentences.english: We, too, may be fearful of some great ones who are bitter against us;
sentences.chinese: 我們也一樣，也會害怕那些仗勢凌人，與我們爲敵者。

sentences.english: Don't try to throw weight around. It won't work with me.
sentences.chinese: 別仗勢欺人，你這一套對我行不通。
